pages.title: Main Gates and East and West Lodges
Kirklee Gate, Kirklee Station, Ford Road

items.text: Parking is available on the roads around this gate.
There's an ice cream stand here in the summer.
You can park here if you like.  No cost as its residential.
Disabled and nursing.  Open 9:00-4:45 in summer, 9:00-4:15 winter

tours.title: The Botanics Trail
tours.description:
The Botanic Gardens Trail starts at the [Visitor Centre](../contents/trail/curators-house.html)
and should take you about one and a half hours to complete.

stops.title: Curator's House/Visitor Centre (1840)
stops.intro:
The Curator's House is the start of the Botanics Trail.
The trail takes about one and a half hours to complete.

stops.title: Main Gates and East and West Lodges
Kirklee Gate, Kirklee Station, Ford Road
Humpback Bridge (1908)
stops.intro: This is where the tour ends.  We hope you've enjoyed it

listings.title: Begonias in the Gardens
listings.description: The Gardens contains the National Begonia Collection

listings.title: Economically important plants
listings.description: Plants which have been, and are, useful

listings.title: Statues in the Kibble Palace
listings.description: The Kibble Palace contains a variety of statues
